Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-01-19T19:50:23Description is in English.Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Women Writing Women's Lives Records
Women Writing Women's Lives
TAM.316
5.5 Linear Feet in 5 record cartons and 1 manuscript box
1989-2015 Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women's Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs, affiliated with the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. Members meet monthly to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters. The collection consists of administrative files, subject files, and notes and lectures from the group's monthly meetings. Materials are in English. Materials are located at the Tamiment Library.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Women Writing Women's Lives donated a collection of their records in 2004. The accession number associated with this gift is 2004.008. Photographs from this collection were originally separated and established as the Women Writing Women's Lives Photograph Collection (PHOTOS 226). These photographs were reincorporated into the Women Writing Women's Lives Records in 2013. The accession numbers associated with these materials are 2004.001 and NPA.2009.027. In 2008, a donation of 57 photographs was made by Claire Morris Stern, chair of the WWWL Archives Committee. The accession number associated with this gift is NPA.2008.045. An additional donation was made by Norah Chase in 2010. In 2013 Claire Morris Stern sent a donation of her personal files, which were added to this collection. The accession number associated with this gift is 2013.044. An additional three boxes of WWWL's records from 2002-2015 were donated in 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 2015.038.
Access Restrictions
Open for research without restrictions.
Use Restrictions
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Women Writings Women's Lives, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2004. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Women Writing Women's Lives Records; TAM 316; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Photographs separated from this collection during initial processing and from new accessions were established as a separate collection, the Women Writing Women's Lives Photographs (PHOTOS 266). In 2013, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Women Writing Women's Lives Records (TAM 316).
Historical/Biographical Note
Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women's Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs. Its members include academics, poets, journalists and novelists. Women Writing Women's Lives is under the aegis of the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.
Monthly meetings, planned by a Steering Committee, are arranged in order for members to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters.
Sources:
Women Writing Womenâ€™s Lives (WWWL) Seminar. http://web.gc.cuny.edu/womencenter/wwwl/
Scope and Content Note
This collection contains the materials of Women Writing Women's Lives and its members. The collection is primarily comprised of proceedings from monthly meetings, but also includes materials such as membership questionnaires, correspondence, photographs of members and meetings, and subject files. The collection also contains correspondence and ephemera from Women Writing Women's Lives special events including anniversary celebrations and speaking events. The collection also contains a number of CDs and VHS recordsing of images and videos from several WWWL events.
The collection also contians the administrative files of Claire Morris Stern, who was a founding member of the organization served as the chair of the Archive Committee. Her files contain correspondence, photographs, and materials related to special events including the Women Writing Women's Lives 20th Anniversary celebration.
Related Archival Materials at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Women Writing Women's Lives Oral History Collection (OH 059)
Separated Materials
Materials related to the donation of Women Writing Women's Lives Records to Tamiment have been removed from the collection.
Arrangement
This collection has been arranged into three series. Series I: Administrative and Committee Records contains the bulk of the collection and is arranged in alphabetical order. Series II: Claire Morris Stern Records is arranged in the order in which the archives received the materials from this donation. Series III: Session Records has been arranged chronologically.

Series I: Administrative and Committee Files1989-2008
Scope and Content Note
The General Files consist of administrative records such as membership applications and questionnaires, financial records, and minutes of the Steering Committee meetings. Clipping and subject files on topics related to women's biography and biographers and photographs of members at a 2008 meeting (where Salli Bingham was the guest speaker) are also included.Anniversary Programs - 5th Anniversary SymposiumMar 17, 199541Anniversary Programs - 10th Anniversary ConferenceDec 8, 200842Anniversary Programs - 15th Anniversary CelebrationOct 28, 200543Anniversary Programs - 20th Anniversary Program - Tamiment May 3, 201044Annual Survey Results (Samples)2002-200345Archives Committee2003-200845Articles (mostly on Women and Biography)1990-199711Attendance Listsundated , 199312Attendance Lists and Seating Charts2002-201146Bernhardt, Debra: MemorialMay 1, 200113Bernikow, Louise199614Book Covers of Publications by Membersundated46Brochure - Old and New Versions2002-200748Conference, 10th AnniversaryDec 8, 200015Contact Lists1997-200216Contact Lists 1997-201349Cook, Blanche Wiesen199517Correspondence1993-200018Correspondence2001-200319Correspondence2002-2011410-19Correspondence2010-201461-2Cover Letter and Questionnaire Drafts for MailingAug 200263Dona Munker New Chair Women Writing Women's Lives (CD containing 48 images and 2 videos)Fall 2011672Finances1991-2001110Floppy Discs (administrative files)1996 , 2002111Flyers199548Grant Proposal (New York Council for the Humanities)2000-2001112Gail Hornstein Speaking to the Women Writing Women's Lives Seminar on the subject of Agnes's Jacket (CD containing 1hr 50 minute audio recording)May 4, 2009672History and Origins (misc. notes on co-founders)69Issues/Controversies2009610Issues: "France"2006611Issues: "Ideologically Skewed"2003612Issues: "Intimidated"2002613Issues: "Plagiarism (as it affected B.
